summary: This document is an email chain from June 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) staff discussing a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reveal confusion and lack of awareness about the FOIA request within the criminal division, highlighting that the Epstein investigation was described as 'very advanced, very sensitive, and, most importantly, very covert' and not widely known even among assistants.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial forwarded email, expressing puzzlement about a FOIA request related to Epstein being processed by the civil division and seeking the right contact to inquire about it.

events.title: FOIA Request Discussion for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a FOIA request related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, revealing the investigation was considered covert and not widely known.

keyFacts: The email chain reveals internal confusion at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in June 2019 regarding a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The criminal investigation into Epstein is described by a participant as 'very advanced, very sensitive, and, most importantly, very covert'.
The email indicates the criminal investigation was not widely known even among assistant U.S. attorneys, leading to puzzlement when the civil division was processing a related FOIA request.
The correspondence shows attempts to identify the correct person in the civil division to inquire about FOIA processes regarding the Epstein case.
